name: Lord of the Doughnut Rings
description: The Serious Eats' Movie Awards Season Recipe Series is brought to you by What if that "ring" was actually referring to a doughnut? What if all that fighting and searching and traipsing through Middle-earth was over a deliciously deep-fried tire...
recipeIngredient: 1 large egg yolk, at room temperature
1/2 cup vegetable shortening, melted and cooled
1/2 muscovado brown sugar for sprinkling (or substitute dark brown sugar)

recipeInstructions.text: Sift the flour, baking powder, nutmeg and salt together into a large mixing bowl. In another large mixing bowl, combine the buttermilk, eggs, egg yolk, granulated sugar, melted vegetable shortening, molasses, and lemon zest.
Pour the oil into a cast-iron Dutch oven or other heavy-bottomed ad deep pot until it reaches a dept of 3 to 4 inches. Heat the oil over medium-high heat to 370°F.

Knead the dough on a well-floured surface for 1 minute, then roll it out with a rolling pin to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut out rounds using a 3 1/2 inch pastry cutter, then cut the centers out with a 1 1/2 inch round. Gather the scraps and re-roll as necessary.
